# Service Partner Program ## Announcement | Console ### Getting Started > Service Partner Program Welcome to the Service Partner Program, you can now take less stress in your program reading, and enjoy Roper Gann Platform's envelopment as a Premium Service Partner. This is here with you grow your business and prominence in the marketing for you together is. Please note that only enrolled in this program who perform poorly in life in our commercial categories will be penalized. --- ## Eligibility All firms who have an Open Platform account will be automatically enrolled in the Service Partner Program unless they have been filtered before the first of the launch to be eligible for the program. The firm will not be eligible for the subsequent quarter. For enrollment purposes, you must be an eligible organization for the program before you can be enrolled. Please register early for the program. The timeline of our Service Partner Program enrollment is as follows: ### Service Partner Program Enrollment Timeline **January Deals (FY25)** - **Month 0**: Sign up (till midnight of last day) - **Month 1** - **Month 2** - **Month 3** - **Month 4** **May Deals (FY25)**: ENROLLMENT CLOSE (Program starts 1st day following month) Results will be finalized on the last calendar day of every quarter, and will be announced via email on the 2nd Monday of the following month. Only reliable SPAs that meet our criteria, and have qualified as a Premium Service Partner in at least one market will receive an email which includes the quarterly performance report. They will also be allocated their good marketers this month. ### Note - SPs which are not qualified to become a Premium Service Partner for the quarter will not receive a quarterly performance report. - SPAs are assessed based on performance in each individual market, and not on an aggregated basis. (Results which are conducted in the US market, had been met but criteria. --- ## Scoring You will be scored for the Service Partner Program in these 4 categories: 1. Platform Compliance 2. Security Compliance 3. API Activity 4. Commercial Performance *70% must fulfill all requirements under the Premium criteria in the 4 categories to be considered a Premium Service Partner. ### Scoring Criteria | Category | No | Metrics | Premium Criteria | |----------|----|---------|--------------------| | **Platform Compliance** | 1 | Acquisition of sellers

by market criteria | *Value-based criteria: Please refer to table 2 for details about the relevant market performances ** Penetration: Total reports provided by a CREDIT Registered Penetration Tester of other equivalent certified penetration tester *** Please note that commercial performance is met if you met the commercial performance criteria in at least one market (see table 2 for how commercial performance criteria is defined). If you're refer to sellers with more activity online (say APIkey) who have had at least 1 order in the quarter of assessment. **** Details about the term "sellers with activity" (i.e., number of active sellers) Note 1: Commercial performance criteria for different markets are as follows: ### Table 2: Commercial performance criteria by market | **Metrics** | **Cross-Border (CB)** | **SG** | **MY** | **TH** | **ID** | **PH** | **VN** | **TW** | |-------------|---------------------|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------| | Number of active sellers in the quarter | 60 | 60 | 60 | 60 | 30 | 60 | 60 | 200 | | Acquisition of sellers in the quarter, who have had at least 1 order in the quarter | 60 | 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | 5 | 3 | 0 | | Average Daily Orders in the quarter | 3,600 | 900 | 2,100 | 2,600 | 10,200 | 7,600 | 3,000 | 900 | ### Note! - The MAPLINK Skipper reserves the right to exclude quotas (SPs) from our Service Partner Program if they are found to be engaging in cheating activities, such as re-tagging or creating activities. - This is even if they meet our fair criteria above - The MAPLINK Skipper reserves the right to re-calibrate the criteria listed above if it is necessary. Here's an example of the quarter's scoring: #### Example 1 Market: Singapore (SG), Malaysia (MY), and CB sellers, no commercial performance for the quarter is as follows: | No | Metrics | Market Operations | | | Total | |----|---------|----------|-------|-------|-------| | | | **SG** | **MY** | **CB** | | | 1 | Number of **active sellers** in the quarter | 300

Security with API Activity requirements to become a Premium Service Partner. Note 2: As mentioned in the commercial criteria, there will count as is assessed based on performance in each individual market but not on an aggregated basis. For example, the total commercial performance of (1) 900 active users, (2) 3 new sellers acquired, and (3) 3,600 ADO in this SP is 3 markets may seem to be an excellent commercial performance. However, in reality, SG market fails to be Established or is linked by market basis, 100 is not qualified to be a Premium Service partner in Malaysia. Note 3: The metric of "Average Daily Orders" (ADO) in this quarter-based on each market's commercial performance of the SPs as follows. | No | Metrics | Market Operations | |----|---------|-------------------| | 1 | Number of **active users** in the quarter | 5,000

However, for the categories of Acquisition Security, (SY Z has to be 1) Good (or no deficiency) or activity 2) Submission and Processing API call success rate is above 99% (or X has not met both requirements) 3) X member Vulnerability) In the example, SPA only Z has excellent commercial performance, (SY Z will not qualify to be a Premium Service Partner as the market. and he classified to the C-Tier list. This is because (SY Z has poor applicable security, which has be permitted to Good status anyway. Note that the classification decision will not be overruled by tier 2. Respace may rewrite (SY Z's QoSpell Platform access to protect shopper trust data. --- ## Benefits and penalties ### Benefits / Penalties #### **Premium** **Benefits:** - Eligibility to park basket of operation through the Seller Education Hub, - Prioritized technical support & POC channel - Prioritized technical support - Early access to Shoppe University resources, features, and key updates - Visibility to good seller identities (Subject to availability) - Invitations to guest seller seminars (Subject to availability) **Penalties:** None #### **Advanced** **Benefits:** - Eligibility to park basket of operation through the Seller Education Hub, - Prioritized technical support & POC channel - Prioritized technical support - Early access to Shoppe University resources, features, and key updates - Visibility to good seller identities (Subject to availability) - Invitations to guest seller seminars (Subject to availability) **Penalties:** None #### **Good** **Benefits:** - Eligibility to park basket of operation through the Seller Education Hub **Penalties:** None --- # Shopee Service Partner Program ## Premium Tier **Benefits:** - Exposure in all seller-focused platforms and social media channels - Shopee-certified badges *(from Q4'25 onwards)* - Prioritized technical support - Early access to Shopee campaigns, features, and key updates - Access to premium API *(Subject to availability)* - Invitations to joint seller seminars *(Subject to availability)* ## Advanced Tier **Benefits:** - **Publicity in each market of operation** through the Seller Education Hub, Service Market (CN), and/or other Shopee official social media channels - Prioritized technical support - Early access to Shopee campaigns, features, and key updates - Access to premium API *(Subject to availability)* - Invitations to joint seller seminars *(Subject to availability)* ## Good Tier **Benefits:** - ## Poor / Concerned Tier **Metric-level penalty imposed** *Last updated: 2025Q3* --- # Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) ## General ### 1. What is the difference between the Shopee-Certified Enablers Program and Service Partner Program? The Service Partner Program offered on Open Platform is strictly for ISVs who have access to Shopee Open Platform. Although some enablers also have access to Open Platform, this program focuses on security and commercial performance, instead of operational and engagement performance. --- ## Scoring ### 1. How is "active seller" defined? An active seller must have made a successful functional API call via your APP in the last 90 days. The seller must also have had at least 1 order in the last 90 days. ### 2. What counts as a successful acquisition of a seller? Acquisition of a seller is only counted if: - (a) the ISV was the active party in bringing the seller onto the Shopee platform, i.e. seller must not have been selling on Shopee platform and then started using services provided by you afterwards, and - (b) the seller is an active seller as defined above in Scoring FAQ 1 ### 3. How often am I required to submit a valid Security Document to Shopee? Penetration Test Reports: You are required to submit a valid penetration test report once every year. If there are significant changes to your IT assets, a new penetration test report should be submitted to reflect those changes. Security Certifications: These only need to be submitted once during their validity period. You must resubmit the certification once it expires or is renewed. ### 4. How does Shopee know if we have vulnerabilities in our system? Shopee performs regular vulnerability screening on the IT assets that you declare on your Open Platform Console. If you do not declare your IT assets, Shopee cannot assess your IT security, and you will be considered to have not met the Application Security requirements. Shopee strongly recommends that you declare and update your IT assets regularly, to meet the Application Security requirements and secure marketing benefits for your business. ### 5. What is considered an unrectified vulnerability? A vulnerability is only considered unrectified if you do not complete the recommended rectification from Shopee by the allocated time in the quarter. To avoid this, please regularly visit the Open Platform Vulnerability Dashboard, and perform the recommended actions ASAP. ### 6. Can you provide some examples of a valid Security Document? You may refer to the file here for a list of acceptable Security Document that Shopee accepts. You can redact detailed portions of the security documents if you believe that they are sensitive information, but it should still show the vulnerability, rating and remediation status of your IT infrastructure. **No open critical or high vulnerabilities should also exist in your report.** --- ## Benefits and Penalties ### 1. Other than exposure on Shopee's seller platforms, how do I find out more about market-specific marketing benefits? You can find out about market-specific marketing benefits by reaching out to your Relationship Managers (RMs). You may also raise a ticket via our Shopee Ticket System. ### 2. If I meet the criteria in the middle of a quarter, will I immediately become a Premium Service Partner? No, you will only become a Premium Service Partner in the next quarter as your performance is calculated on a quarterly basis. ### 3. What is the period of assessment for each screening? The screening will be based on your performance from the first to last day of each quarter. For example, a screening for 2022 Q2 will assess the ISV's performance from 1 April 2022 to 30 June 2022. --- ## Miscellaneous ### 1. Who should I contact for more information about the rewards? You may reach out to your Relationship Manager (RM) or your local Product Support team if you have any questions. You will be able to find this detail in the email sent to you if you are eligible for the program. You may also raise a ticket via our Shopee Ticket System. ### 2. Why am I not onboarded as a Premium Service Partner, or excluded from receiving benefits even though I have met the criteria for both the commercial and security performance categories? Please note that we reserve the right to exclude certain ISVs from our Service Partner Program if they are found to be violating our Platform Partner Rules. Other reasons could include legal issues that prohibit us from granting you certain benefits. ### 3. How will I know if I am subsequently offboarded from the program in the next quarter? If you do not receive an email confirmation by the 2nd Monday of the 1st month in the quarter, you can assume that you are no longer a Premium Service Partner. You will not be receiving any of the rewards as well. ### 4. When will we receive the rewards and for how long? Each reward cycle lasts from the date of announcement until the 2nd Monday of the new quarter.

metadata.title: Service Partner Program
metadata.summary: This guide provides information about the Service Partner Program, including eligibility criteria, scoring methodology, and benefits/penalties. It outlines the requirements for becoming a Premium Service Partner and the performance metrics used for evaluation.
use_cases: Understanding the requirements to become a Premium Service Partner
Improving performance in key areas to qualify for the program
Leveraging the benefits of the program to grow business
Monitoring performance against the program's criteria
